author: Nagesh Prabhu
text:
Price of petrol to go up by Rs. 1.89a litre, diesel by 98 paise from tomorrow

Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has ruled out rolling back the increase in sales tax on petrol and diesel which is to come to effect from Friday.

With this, the prices of petrol and diesel in Karnataka will increase by Rs. 1.89 and 98 paise a litre respectively from Friday.

In his reply to the discussion on the State Budget proposals on Wednesday, Mr. Siddaramaiah said sales tax on petrol had been increased from 26 per cent to 30 per cent and while that on diesel from 16.65 per cent to 19 per cent.

Defending the increase in the sales tax on fuel, he said the Centre had increased the excise duty on petrol and diesel four times when the prices of fuel declined from $130 to $28 a barrel. However, the State government did not raise the taxes on diesel and petrol in the middle of the year, and the benefits had been passed on to consumers, he said.

He said continuous fall in the crude oil prices had reduced commercial tax collection by Rs. 800 crore in 2015–16. The hike in fuel prices would not hit hard the poor and common people, he claimed.

title: CM rules out rollback of hike in sales tax on petrol, diesel
